t: A Psalm{H4210} of David{H1732}. The LORD{H3068} said{H5002}{(H8803)} unto my Lord{H113}, Sit{H3427}{(H8798)} thou at my right hand{H3225}, until I make{H7896}{(H8799)} thine enemies{H341}{(H8802)} thy footstool{H1916}{H7272}.
The LORD{H3068} shall send{H7971}{(H8799)} the rod{H4294} of thy strength{H5797} out of Zion{H6726}: rule{H7287}{(H8798)} thou in the midst{H7130} of thine enemies{H341}{(H8802)}.

Thy people{H5971} shall be willing{H5071} in the day{H3117} of thy power{H2428}, in the beauties{H1926} of holiness{H6944} from the womb{H7358} of the morning{H4891}: thou hast the dew{H2919} of thy youth{H3208}.
The LORD{H3068} hath sworn{H7650}{(H8738)}, and will not repent{H5162}{(H8735)}, Thou art a priest{H3548} for ever{H5769} after the order{H1700} of Melchizedek{H4442}.
The Lord{H136} at thy right hand{H3225} shall strike{H4272}{(H8804)} through kings{H4428} in the day{H3117} of his wrath{H639}.

He shall judge{H1777}{(H8799)} among the heathen{H1471}, he shall fill{H4390}{(H8804)} the places with the dead bodies{H1472}; he shall wound{H4272}{(H8804)} the heads{H7218} over many{H7227} countries{H776}.
He shall drink{H8354}{(H8799)} of the brook{H5158} in the way{H1870}: therefore shall he lift up{H7311}{(H8686)} the head{H7218}.
